alert.note: Alert for North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 30 at 5:55AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota, north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following areas, in east central Minnesota, Crow Wing and Northern Aitkin. In north central Minnesota, Koochiching, North Cass, North Itasca, South Cass and South Itasca. In northeast Minnesota, North St. Louis. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several more rounds of thunderstorms will occur through northern Minnesota through Monday night. Heavy rainfall will be possible due to the storms. Rivers, streams, and lakes are already running high so additional rainfall could lead to additional flooding or exacerbate existing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
